wordpressPost.title: Should you take Ginkgo everyday?
wordpressPost.content:
Should you take Ginkgo every day?

 

Research shows that taking Ginkgo can have positive short-term effects on the brain, specifically, memories, mood, and sociability.

In a research study, half of a group was given Ginkgo, and the other half were given a placebo.

The group that took the Ginkgo supplement had immediate and significant improvement in short-term memory, compared to the placebo group.

Ginkgo is not a stimulant but sharpens memory by improving blood circulation and also, enhances the nerve and cell communications.

Some people who take Ginkgo take it before doing projects like writing, reading or other tasks that require sharp mental clarity.  It’s almost like a brain boost.

Those who take exams may want to take a dose of Ginkgo beforehand.

Studies have also shown that Ginkgo helps with the delay of Alzheimer’s by slowing down the age-related effects of the disease.

For those of us who are over forty, Ginkgo may play an important part in the age-related disease.  It may help with vision related disease and hearing loss.

The herb also helps with boosting blood flow to tiny vessels that feed our eyes and ears.  Ginkgo may even go so far as protecting our eyesight from such diseases like diabetic retinopathy, cataracts, and macular degeneration.

For our ears, it may help with tinnitus, vertigo, dizziness, and other equilibrium problems.

Ginkgo shows to help with circulation problems for example, it can ease problems such as peripheral arterial insufficiency which is basically, poor circulation.

An alternative to taking drugs, men can use Ginkgo for impotence caused by insufficient blood flow.

Ginkgo offers another benefit against heart attack and stroke.  It helps prevent blood clots and sticky platelets.

Should you take Ginkgo everyday?

 

Millions of people take Ginkgo everyday.  In many other countries, there is a standard recommendation that doctors give to their patients.

The information given here is not to tell you to take any supplement without talking with your health care provider first.  However, it is clear that Ginkgo has it’s benefits and perhaps, you should do your own research to see if Ginkgo is right for you.

The thing about taking Ginkgo is finding the right one to take.  They’re not all the same.  According to Timothy J. Smith, M.D. in his book “Renewal,” he suggests to his patients that they take “24 percent standardized extract.”

Standardized means that basically, it was verified in an approved lab and measured for it’s effectiveness.

As per Dr. Timothy J. Smith, he suggests to stay clear of all non-standardized products because one never knows if they are getting a therapeutic dose or not.

To recap here, taking a standardized Ginkgo everyday has proven to help with the nervous system, circulatory system and sensory system.

Referenced from: “Renewal” By Timothy J. Smith, M.D.
